alert.note: Alert for Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 1:28AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Johnson, southeastern Benton, northern Washington, western Jones, Linn and eastern Iowa Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 128 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oxford, or 14 miles southeast of Marengo, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Oxford around 135 AM CDT. Amana around 140 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Walford, Swisher, Shueyville, Cedar Rapids, Fairfax, Ely, Bertram, Hiawatha, Marion, Robins, Toddville, Alburnett and Whittier. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 226 and 241. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Iowa; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Washington
